meanings.definition: A small amount or portion of something.
meanings.sent1: Mom added a dallop of ketchup to my plate.
meanings.sent2: I only need a dallop of sugar for my tea.
meanings.sent3: The tiny dallop of icing on the cupcake made it extra special.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a sweet dallop of sunshine on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The dallop of cream on the pie was the perfect finishing touch.

meanings.definition: To add a small amount of something to a dish.
meanings.sent1: Please dallop some honey on the pancakes.
meanings.sent2: She likes to dallop whipped cream on her hot cocoa.
meanings.sent3: He dalloped a bit of hot sauce on his tacos for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: The chef dalloped a drizzle of olive oil on the salad.
meanings.sent5: Dallop the dressing gently over the salad for the best taste.

meanings.definition: To distribute or spread something in small amounts.
meanings.sent1: The baker dalloped blueberries throughout the muffin batter.
meanings.sent2: She dalloped jam on each slice of bread.
meanings.sent3: The artist dalloped paint on the canvas in a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: He dalloped sauce on the pizza with precision.
meanings.sent5: Dallop the herbs evenly over the pasta for a burst of flavor.
